generalInfo: South Africa is a premier destination for luxury travel as it boasts immaculate wildlife encounters and world-class sightseeing experiences. The country has a profound historical past which forms a significant foundation of its global appeal. The country’s diverse culture shines through the significant heritage sights and attractions that are located in its oldest city, Cape Town. On this immersive tour of the metropolitan city, as you explore the prominent points of interest, you will trace back the roots of this historic nation and discover what makes Cape Town such a thrilling location to visit.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Luxury Living by the Sea
dayInfo.description: You will land in the energetic city of Cape Town alongside an array of eager travelers and cultural enthusiasts. Your extensive exploration of the city will begin as you leave the airport. From the comfort of your private transfer, you will witness the diverse Western Cape landscape as you journey to the heart of the city. You will pass by agricultural towns and remote rural areas as you approach its center. Nearing the Nelson Mandela Boulevard, you will witness the mighty Table Mountain reaching towards the clouds. You will wrap around the mountain range and dip down into the bustling streets of Cape Town. Shortly after, you will reach your luxury accommodation in the renowned V&A Waterfront. After a seamless check-in, you will find yourself gazing out at the incredible ocean views from your private balcony that overlooks the waterfront and surrounding areas. This exquisite room will serve as an idyllic resting spot to conclude your culturally immersive adventures each day. The late-setting sun will still be shining in the sky, giving you the perfect opportunity to explore the waterfront and become acclimated to the exuberant city before nightfall. From your hotel lobby, you will meet your knowledgeable guide and venture to the port for a brief, yet fascinating tour of the V&A that will reveal insight into the city’s colonial past. You will visit a harbor museum and associated landmarks, which capture the European influence over the city. This influence and deep-rooted South African traditions will culminate into a riveting display of history and modernity that underpin many facets of the Cape Town lifestyle. You will bring the tour to an ideal close with a fine-dining sunset cruise. As you gently float along the Atlantic Ocean, you will enjoy freshly caught seafood dishes, and you will truly delight in the harbor side city’s rich cuisine as you witness the majestic sunset over the distant horizon. After which, you will transfer to the shore and return to your cozy room for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – A Captivating Discovery of Cape Culture
dayInfo.description: You will rise the next morning to sweeping ocean views, eager for the adventure ahead. While the hotel prepares an elegant breakfast for you each morning, on this day you will privately transfer to a leading morning market for an indulging taste of traditional South African food and treats. The sought-after farmers market, which is located nearby your hotel, is a public passion project that is driven by eco-conscious agricultural philosophies. You will find an assortment of locally-run business stalls that sell environmentally-friendly, authentic foods and goods to the hundreds of people that attend every weekend. From the smell of freshly squeezed fruit juice to the delightfully salty flavors of Biltong , which is South African cured and dried meat, the market will tantalize your taste buds in true South African fashion. With gorgeous views of the ocean and like-minded travelers to meet, you will be thoroughly entertained throughout your exploration of the morning market. Afterward, you will transfer to your hotel and meet your private guide for the day. Your guide, who will be exceptionally well-versed in Cape Town history, will eagerly transfer you to the city’s impressive cultural landmarks. Moreover, your guide will offer in-depth insight into the region’s rich, historical roots. The journey will take you to premier destinations such as the Bo Kaap. Here, you will capture vivid pictures of the brightly colored Cape Malay houses that are nestled at the base of Signal Hill. The historical area, which has recently received heritage protection, immaculately highlights age-old Cape living. From the streets, wafts of spicy curries will surround you, and the magnificent Table Mountain will tower over you. After fully immersing yourself, you will continue through to many more prominent landmarks and destinations where you will weave your way through the winding Cape roads that lie along the base of the mountain, visiting recognized memorials and witnessing scenic settings. Last but not least, the tour will transfer you to Signal Hill. After a short climb up the hill, you will be welcomed by a 360-degree view of the entire city. You will enjoy a delightful, evening picnic after learning more about the location. From these great heights, you will witness a picture-perfect sunset as hang gliders leap off the majestic hill and soar across the sky. Later this evening, you will make your way to a leading Cape Town restaurant for an elaborate, gourmet meal.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Remarkable Robben Island
dayInfo.description: Today, you will wake up feeling completely refreshed and enjoy a hearty start to the morning with a delicious breakfast spread at your hotel. Today, you will learn a great deal more about the country’s remarkable history. From your lobby, you will enjoy a leisurely stroll to the port where you will board a cruise that is bound for the famous Robben Island. The UNESCO World Heritage Site is home to the cell where former South African president, Nelson Mandela, spent 18 years of his imprisonment. Now, a must-visit monument to the great man and the story of his life, this dramatic trip to Robben Island will fill you with great admiration for the lengths that exceptional people will go to protect their nations and their people. During this tour, you will encounter the major significant sites that are situated around the island. Your cultured tour guide will share intriguing stories about the city’s tumultuous past and impressive achievements. The valuable educational experience will be complete with gorgeous views of the Western Cape shores and encounters with various local wildlife. After a thorough exploration and the culmination of the tour at Nelson Mandela’s cell, you will board the cruise ship and head to land. After arriving, you will transfer to your hotel for the afternoon at your leisure where you can take the opportunity to lounge in comfort around the pool or enjoy a South African Afternoon tea that is complete with traditional snacks and delicacies. Later today, you will transfer to the base of Table Mountain. As it exudes its imposing glory, you will hop into a Cable Car and climb to the top of the mountain. Here, amongst the clouds, you will witness breathtaking, panoramic views of the entire city and the greater Cape region. You will witness stunning moments on top of the mountain as you peer down to the seemingly tiny city. Before you make your way back down, you will relish in a fine-dining experience from these great heights, and you will allow the evening to slowly pass by as you indulge all of your senses. Finally, you will journey down the mountain and return to your room for a night in peaceful luxury.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Southernmost Tip of Africa
dayInfo.description: Many distinct Cape suburbs sprawl across the region, each offering entirely unique cultural experiences that are rooted in their individual history. The fourth day of your trip will be spent broadening your cultural Cape horizons with an engaging exploration of these essential destinations. After fueling up on a scrumptious breakfast at your hotel, you will meet your private tour guide and venture out for an in-depth Cape Peninsula Tour. This cultural excursion will take you along the winding coastal roads that lead through lush forests, along rugged mountainsides, and down to brilliant beaches. The beauty of this enriching tour will be highlighted by the wondrous wildlife and stunning scenery that you will witness on the way to the celebrated Cape of Good Hope. En route, you will discover premier destinations including Hout Bay and Boulders Beach. You can take this opportunity to tuck into the traditional South African fish and chips, which will be caught fresh that same day. Furthermore, you will enjoy the warmer waters of the Indian Ocean and swim alongside African penguins at Boulders Beach. These, as well as a scenic drive along the endearing Chapman’s Peak route, are just a few of the highlights you will experience during your journey. The excitement of the trip will culminate once you arrive at the Cape of Good Hope, the southernmost tip of Africa. Here, where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet, you will soak up the splendor of the wildlife that surrounds you. The cool breeze will swoop down the magnificent mountain ranges and whip out into the ocean where waves ebb and flow against the shore. The serene setting will serve as an idyllic location to capture lifelong memories. After your thoroughly enthusing day around the Cape Peninsula, you will transfer to your guesthouse that will be located in the valley of Cape Town’s most coveted beachside suburb: Llandudno. The premier beach will be situated off the beaten track, accessible via a single road that leads down into the valley. For this reason, it will be the perfect getaway destination for the evening. Llandudno’s beauty is highlighted by its pristine, crystal-clear waters and smooth boulder cliffs that enclose the bay on both sides. On this afternoon, you will walk out of your luxurious guesthouse onto the sand and sit comfortably under the shade of the nearby rocks where you will enjoy the refreshing embrace of the Atlantic Ocean and delight in the leisurely time to unwind. In the evening, you will transfer to Camps Bay for a gorgeous sunset that will be paired with exquisite cocktails. The elegant and fashion-forward suburb boasts some of Cape Town’s best haute cuisine restaurants for you to choose from for your evening meal. After which, you will return to your guesthouse in Llandudno for a peaceful sleep away from the crowds.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Flavors of the Cape
dayInfo.description: A huge part of Cape Town’s rich culture is showcased in its divine food and delicious beverages. Served humbly at traditional eateries or meticulously curated at upper-class establishments, the food and beverage scene offers a range of exquisite experiences. On your fifth day, you will discover all of Cape Town’s best dishes with an extensive cultural food tour. You will begin your journey immediately in the morning and skip the breakfast spread at your hotel to save precious time. Once picked up by your private transfer, you will venture to the many marvelous dining spots. Your first stop will be a leading coffee roaster in the city center. Here, you will taste a few of their premium blends that will be accompanied by South African pastries and snacks. After which, you will travel to Cape Town’s premier biscuit mill for a taste of some of its finer, fashionable boutique foods. All the while, you will take in the diverse scenes and mingle with other enthusiastic travelers and locals. You will journey to an established, award-winning restaurant for lunch and get the opportunity to meet the head chef behind the classy cuisine. Your behind-the-scenes look into Cape Town’s food culture will end perfectly with a trip to a traditional Shisa nyama , which is a Zulu phrase that loosely translates to braai or barbecue. The local hotspot, which is situated in a Cape Town township, will give you the opportunity to immerse yourself in authentic South African living. Surrounded by friendly faces and like-minded foodies, you will feel completely welcome at this sought-after Shisa nyama . In the afternoon, you will briefly return to your hotel before meeting your private transfer and setting off once again. This time, you will discover the city’s vibrant art culture. You will journey to leading galleries of both traditional and contemporary art. One of the highlights of this tour will be a visit to the Zeitz MOCAA, which is a riveting art museum that has been dedicated to contemporary African art. If this day happens to be the first Thursday of the month, or if you specifically request this, then you will experience the entertaining First Thursday Cape Town Initiative. On this day, the city becomes an energetic ode to art where restaurants and galleries open up their doors freely for an evening of artistic appreciation. Otherwise, you will be just as thrilled continuing your extensive tour of the city’s leading arts and cultural museums.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – A Taste of the Best
dayInfo.description: On the sixth day of your trip, you will enjoy a scenic drive out of the city limits into the Stellenbosch countryside after a satisfying breakfast to begin your day. Stellenbosch, although experiencing rapid growth over the past few decades, is an enchanting town whose architecture exquisitely reflects its old-world charm. Its Dutch-colonial influence can still be prominently seen, and you will bask in the opportunity to witness the marvelous cultural highlights in and around the town. Your private transfer will then take you on a tour of the pinnacle Stellenbosch attraction for its world-famous wine route. You will transfer to the town’s premier, renowned wine estates and delight in distinguished blends and vintages at each destination. Accompanied by a selection of cured meats and cheeses, each tasting will truly invigorate all of your senses. Your tasting guides will offer insight into each bottle as well as the deep cultural roots and heritage of the estates and their owners. The historically-inclined tasting tour along Stellenbosch’s famous wine route is a one-of-a-kind cultural experience just outside of Cape Town that is not to be missed. As you sip away at each wine, you will witness the stunning views of the extensive vineyards and mountain ranges in the distance. Then, you will delight in an elegantly served supper at a prestigious estate to bring the indulgent day to a close. Shortly afterward, you will transfer back to your tranquil abode in Llandudno for one last evening by the sea where you can soak up the surroundings and breathe in the fresh oceanic air as you drift off to sleep.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – A Journey of Growth
dayInfo.description: Before you set off back home, there will be one last must-visit destination to experience. You will enjoy a delicious breakfast at one of the city’s foremost beachside cafes. Then, your private transfer will take you to the reputable Kirstenbosch Gardens for a morning among the wilderness. Here, you will have a few hours to bask in the scenic Western Cape settings. Nestled at the base of Table Mountain, the massive national botanical garden is home to an abundance of diverse flora and fauna. You can explore the intriguing plant life that is native to the region as you weave your way through the enchanting paths in the gardens. As you go deeper into the park, you will encounter picturesque views of the greenery around you and intricate flowers that are in full bloom. The wondrous wildlife will offer a truly peaceful and gratifying way to end your culturally immersive journey through the Cape. After your splendid morning, you will transfer to Cape Town International Airport where you will say your goodbyes to the vibrant city. Unfortunately, you will know have to jet off into the sky with only irreplaceable memories of this city’s remarkable history.
